intro: Aira chinensis, commonly known as Chinese air黍, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces distinctive pale green to yellowish flowers that are arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Aira chinensis is also valued for its historical use in traditional agriculture and as a forage crop.
